page.title: 03The Pier.
page.content: The pier, designed by John James Webster and built in 1896 by a Mr.Thorne, both from London, is now in the process of reconstruction. The original purpose was as a landing stage for large boats from Liverpool. Passengers could then walk ashore unlike previously when they had to rely on a small boat to carry them across the shallow water. The pier cost nearer{Â£40,000}than the estimated {Â£17,000}because it was originally designed 200 feet too short to reach deep water. It measures 1,550 feet long and 24 feet wide wideing out to 55 feet at the pierhead. The structure was closed in 1971 because of metal erosion. Bangor{City {Council}bought it from the{County {Council}for 1d and with grants, donations and sponsorship are nearing completion of the reconstruction.
